citations.desc: Records: Operators of auction sales and brokers.
citations.narrative:
Review of records dated 08/22/2024 showed one male common marmoset (tag number 7515), one female green monkey
(tag number 7580) and one male green monkey (tag number 7579) were purchased by an individual. The invoice did not
contain the date of birth or approximate age of the animals. A copy of the record containing a description of the animals
which includes the date of birth, or an approximate age shall be given to the purchaser of each animal. Complete and
accurate records are required to ensure compliance with the Animal Welfare Act. Correct from this date forward,
09/19/2024, by ensuring that all records, including those provided by the purchaser, contain all required information
including a complete description of the animals with the date of birth or approximate age.

citations.desc: Procurement of dogs, cats, and other animals; dealers.
citations.narrative:
Review of records dated 08/22/2024 showed one three-year-old male ring-tailed lemur, tag number 7807, was consigned
to the facility for sale. There was no USDA license number recorded for the consignor. A valid license or one-time
exemption is required to sell non-human primates. The consignor had neither. No dealer shall knowingly obtain any
animal from any person who is required to be licensed but who does not hold a current, valid, and unsuspended license.
Animals sold by individuals that do not have a valid USDA license when required may suffer from poor welfare due to lack
of compliance with the Animal Welfare Act. Correct by ensuring that all consignors of covered species hold a current, valid
and unsuspended license from this date forward, 09/19/2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
Marla Renshaw, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.76(b) 
   
Records: Operators of auction sales and brokers. 
Review of records dated 08/22/2024 showed one male common marmoset (tag number 7515), one female green monkey 
(tag number 7580) and one male green monkey (tag number 7579) were purchased by an individual. The invoice did not 
contain the date of birth or approximate age of the animals. A copy of the record containing a description of the animals 
which includes the date of birth, or an approximate age shall be given to the purchaser of each animal. Complete and 
accurate records are required to ensure compliance with the Animal Welfare Act. Correct from this date forward, 
09/19/2024, by ensuring that all records, including those provided by the purchaser, contain all required information 
including a complete description of the animals with the date of birth or approximate age. 
2.132(d) 
   
Procurement of dogs, cats, and other animals; dealers. 
Review of records dated 08/22/2024 showed one three-year-old male ring-tailed lemur, tag number 7807, was consigned 
to the facility for sale. There was no USDA license number recorded for the consignor. A valid license or one-time 
exemption is required to sell non-human primates. The consignor had neither. No dealer shall knowingly obtain any 
animal from any person who is required to be licensed but who does not hold a current, valid, and unsuspended license. 
Animals sold by individuals that do not have a valid USDA license when required may suffer from poor welfare due to lack 
of compliance with the Animal Welfare Act. Correct by ensuring that all consignors of covered species hold a current, valid 
and unsuspended license from this date forward, 09/19/2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Marla Renshaw, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
